results.title: My friend Hans from Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
Tells something of the life of Hans, a German boy living in the village of Garmisch-Partenkirchen near Munich in Bavaria. Shows the harvest season and the unusual tradition of sheltering cattle under houses. Throughout the year Hans goes skiing on the nearby Zugspitz Mountain.

results.title: My Friend Flicka
results.creator_credit: Ralph Dietrich, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Harold Schuster
results.brief_description: A young boy is determined to befriend a rebellious horse in this touching family film based on the celebrated novel by Mary O’Hara. Setting his heart on winning Flicka’s confidence and ultimately taming her, Ken begins to grow up a little and everyone learns some important lessons in this poignant tale of love, patience, faith and ‘hope beyond hope’. Stars Roddy McDowall and Preston Foster.

Episodes include: My friend Angelmouse; Lost Thingamajig; Windy weather day; Trumpet; Baby Ellie’s Presents; Angelcake; Copycat chick; Angelmouse’s day off; A Visitor for Angelmouse; Angelmouse’s reward.

results.title: My Favourite wife
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, RKO Radio Pictures and Garson Kanin
results.brief_description: Eight years after his wife’s disappearance in a shipwreck, Nick Arden remarries. However Ellen is not dead and reappears in time to join Nick and his new wife Bianca on their honeymoon. Nick lacks the courage to tell Bianca the truth and the situation becomes more complicated when he discovers that Ellen was not alone on her “desert island.” Starring Irene Dunne, Cary Grant, Randolph Scott and Gail Patrick. This comedy will delight lovers of the suave Cary Grant.

results.title: My favourite brunette
results.creator_credit: Daniel Dare, Paramount Pictures, Hope Enterprises and Elliott Nugent
results.brief_description: Ronnie Jackson (Bob Hope), a prisoner in San Quentin awaiting the death sentence recounts how he went from baby photographer to detective when the tenant across the hall, detective McLeod (Alan Ladd in an unbilled role), goes away for the weekend leaving Jackson in charge of the phones. Enter the eponymous beautiful brunette, Baroness Carlotta Montay (Dorothy Lamour), who throws herself on the mercy of Jackson (whom she’s mistaken for McLeod) to locate her kidnapped Uncle. Living his dream profession, Jackson’s first case leads him to question whether Carlotta is schizophrenic, whether the missing man is her Uncle or husband, whether men in wheelchairs can walk, and why everyone is intent on securing the map that Carlotta has entrusted to him. Feature a knife wielding Peter Lorre and a dippy Lon Chaney as a henchman at a Sanitarium. This tongue in cheek take on hard boiled detective films in the vein of Raymond Chandler is one of Hope’s three “My favourite” films, the others being “My favourite blond” and “My favorite spy”.
